mongochat

Class ChatObserverThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • mongochat.ChatObserverThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ChatObserverThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A Thread that uses the MongoClient of a Client to observe changes in the MessageCollection and direct all new Messages to the Clients output stream.

    It is expected to be used in multithreading environments and autostarts on creation.

    Author:
    Manuel Batsching

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChatObserverThread(Client client)
      Constructs a ChatObserverThread from a Client.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Interrupt the current ChatObserverThread.
      void run()
      This method is automatically called on creation, so there should be no need to run it manually.
